briefdescription.para: Initializes a DBusSignatureIter for reading a type signature.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not safe to use on invalid signatures; be sure to validate potentially invalid signatures with dbus_signature_validate before using this function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an iterator to initialize

briefdescription.para: Returns the current type pointed to by the iterator.

detaileddescription.para: If the iterator is pointing at a type code such as 's', then it will be returned directly.

However, when the parser encounters a container type start character such as '(' for a structure, the corresponding type for the container will be returned, e.g. DBUS_TYPE_STRUCT, not '('. In this case, you should initialize a sub-iterator with dbus_signature_iter_recurse() to parse the container type.

briefdescription.para: Returns the signature of the single complete type starting at the given iterator.

detaileddescription.para: For example, if the iterator is pointing at the start of "(ii)ii" (which is "a struct of two ints, followed by an int, followed by an int"), then "(ii)" would be returned. If the iterator is pointing at one of the "i" then just that "i" would be returned.

simplesect.para: current signature; or NULL if no memory. Should be freed with dbus_free()

briefdescription.para: Convenience function for returning the element type of an array; This function allows you to avoid initializing a sub-iterator and getting its current type.

detaileddescription.para: Undefined behavior results if you invoke this function when the current type of the iterator is not DBUS_TYPE_ARRAY.

briefdescription.para: Skip to the next value on this "level".

detaileddescription.para: e.g. the next field in a struct, the next value in an array. Returns FALSE at the end of the current container.

simplesect.para: FALSE if nothing more to read at or below this level

briefdescription.para: Initialize a new iterator pointing to the first type in the current container.

detaileddescription.para: The results are undefined when calling this if the current type is a non-container (i.e. if dbus_type_is_container() returns FALSE for the result of dbus_signature_iter_get_current_type()).

parameterdescription.para: an iterator to initialize pointing to the first child

briefdescription.para: Check a type signature for validity.

detaileddescription.para: Remember that NULL can always be passed instead of a DBusError*, if you don't care about having an error name and message.

simplesect.para: TRUE if signature is valid or FALSE if an error is set

briefdescription.para: Check that a type signature is both valid and contains exactly one complete type.

detaileddescription.para: "One complete type" means a single basic type, array, struct, or dictionary, though the struct or array may be arbitrarily recursive and complex. More than one complete type would mean for example "ii" or two integers in sequence.

simplesect.para: TRUE if signature is valid and has exactly one complete type

briefdescription.para: A "basic type" is a somewhat arbitrary concept, but the intent is to include those types that are fully-specified by a single typecode, with no additional type information or nested values.

detaileddescription.para: So all numbers and strings are basic types and structs, arrays, and variants are not basic types. DBUS_TYPE_INVALID is not a basic type.
It is an error to pass an invalid type-code, other than DBUS_TYPE_INVALID, to this function. The valid type-codes are defined by dbus-protocol.h.

parameterdescription.para: either a valid type-code or DBUS_TYPE_INVALID

briefdescription.para: A "container type" can contain basic types, or nested container types.

detaileddescription.para: DBUS_TYPE_INVALID is not a container type.
It is an error to pass an invalid type-code, other than DBUS_TYPE_INVALID, to this function. The valid type-codes are defined by dbus-protocol.h.

parameterdescription.para: either a valid type-code or DBUS_TYPE_INVALID

simplesect.para: TRUE if type is a container

briefdescription.para: Tells you whether values of this type can change length if you set them to some other value.

detaileddescription.para: For this purpose, you assume that the first byte of the old and new value would be in the same location, so alignment padding is not a factor.
This function is useful to determine whether dbus_message_iter_get_fixed_array() may be used.
Some structs are fixed-size (if they contain only fixed-size types) but struct is not considered a fixed type for purposes of this function.
It is an error to pass an invalid type-code, other than DBUS_TYPE_INVALID, to this function. The valid type-codes are defined by dbus-protocol.h.

parameterdescription.para: either a valid type-code or DBUS_TYPE_INVALID

simplesect.para: FALSE if the type can occupy different lengths

ref.tooltip: Macro used prior to declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
Macro used after declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
